author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Rio Ferdinand questions Arsene Wenger's ambition after dropping Petr Cech for Bayern Munich clash | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news search metro follow us rio ferdinand

text:
Search Metro Follow us Rio Ferdinand questions Arsene Wenger’s decision to drop Petr Cech for David Ospina for Bayern Munich clash Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 10:56 pm Rio Ferdinand has questioned Arsenal’s ambition (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United legend Rio Ferdinand has questioned Arsenal’s ambition and believes Arsene Wenger is wrong to drop Petr Cech in favour of David Ospina in the Champions League knockout stages. 
The Gunners take on Bayern Munich at the Allianz Arena on Wednesday and will be hoping to reach the last-8 of the competition for the first time in six years. 
Wenger confirmed on Tuesday that he will drop Cech in favour of Ospina for the clash against the Germans, despite the fact that the Colombian has made just eight appearances this term. 
Cech has started every single Premier League game this term and Ferdinand believes the move will hinder the Gunners against Carlo Ancelotti’s men. Wenger has confirmed he will opt for Ospina over Cech (Picture: Getty) 
‘I don’t get this. Cech’s your best goalkeeper. Do you want to win the competition or not?’ Ferdinand told BTSport. 
‘Play your best goalkeeper. When the keeper changes it throws things out – no matter who he is. 
‘You’re used to playing with your number one goalkeeper, which is Cech every week. The centre halves immediately will be thinking “there’s something different behind me” and it creates uncertainty.’
